definitions.definition: A Christian house of worship ; a building where Christian religious services take place.
examples: There is a lovely little church in the valley.
This building used to be a church before being converted into a library.

definitions.definition: Christians collectively seen as a single spiritual community ; Christianity ; Christendom .
examples: These worshippers make up the Church of Christ.

definitions.definition: A local group of people who follow the same Christian religious beliefs, local or general.

examples: The Church of England separated from the Roman Catholic Church in 1534.

definitions.definition: Christian worship held at a church; service .
Organized religion in general or a specific religion considered as a political institution .
examples: Many constitutions enshrine the separation of church and state.

definitions.definition: Any religious group or place of worship; a temple .
examples: She goes to a Wiccan church down the road.

main_definition: ( countable , Christianity ) A Christian house of worship ; a building where Christian religious services take place. [from 9th c.]
secondary_definitions: Christians collectively seen as a single spiritual community ; Christianity ; Christendom . [from 9th c.]
( countable ) A local group of people who follow the same Christian religious beliefs, local or general. [from 9th c.]
( countable ) A particular denomination of Christianity . [from 9th c.]
( uncountable , countable , as bare noun ) Christian worship held at a church; service . [from 10th c.]
( uncountable ) Organized religion in general or a specific religion considered as a political institution .
( informal ) Any religious group or place of worship; a temple . [from 16th c.]
